triples.name: Monte Carlo method
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a Monte-Carlo simulation algorithm as the core method for real-time policy improvement.

triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: The paper uses reinforcement learning concepts including expected reward and policy improvement to drive the algorithm.

triples.name: Backgammon
triples.relevance: Backgammon is the primary application domain where the proposed algorithm is tested and evaluated.

triples.name: TD-Gammon
triples.relevance: TD-Gammon is used as a baseline and strong initial policy against which the Monte-Carlo algorithm's improvements are measured.

triples.name: Neural network
triples.relevance: Neural networks are used in TD-Gammon, which serves as the baseline policy for comparison with the proposed algorithm.

triples.name: IBM Scalable POWERparallel
triples.relevance: The IBM SP1 and SP2 supercomputers are the parallel computing platforms used to implement the algorithm.
